title: The BBC will make a show for Netflix despite concerns the streaming giant is stealing viewers
text:
The BBC is making its first show for Netflix despite concerns that the streaming giant’s success has hit it hard.

The corporation’s commercial programme-making wing will produce a four-part documentary series for the US media giant about pioneering surgeons.

The rise of subscription services such as Netflix has been blamed for luring younger viewers away from the BBC, while also pushing up the cost of making shows.

The BBC is making its first show for Netflix - with four hour-long episodes focusing on cardiology, neurosurgery and transplant operations underway and will be available next year. Netflix already streams Doctor Who and Sherlock but it is the first time BBC is making a programme for them (file image)

The BBC has previously promised a total transformation of its iPlayer service to compete with Netflix and Amazon Prime Video (file image)

Netflix already streams old BBC programmes including Doctor Who and Sherlock, but this is the first time the corporation has made one for the firm.

The series – which will run next year – will feature four hour-long episodes focusing on areas including cardiology, neurosurgery and transplant operations.

James van der Pool, of BBC Studios’ science unit, said: ‘This new series offers an intimate understanding into the minds of these trailblazing surgeons and the remarkable journeys that led to them becoming innovators within their fields.

‘We see the ingenuity, skill and risks that make up a surgeon’s work. We’re thrilled to give viewers such an insider’s view, as well as increase their knowledge of anatomy.’

In a speech last year, BBC director-general Tony Hall highlighted the fact that Netflix spends more on content than all of the main UK broadcasters combined.

The original series by BBC will offer an 'intimate understanding' into the minds of 'trailblazing surgeons' and hopes to 'increase knowledge on anatomy', according to James van der Pool, of BBC Studios’ science unit
description: The BBC is making a show about 'trailblazing surgeons' for Netflix - due to be aired next year. Episodes to be four hours long and hope to 'increase knowledge on anatomy', says BBC Studios.
authors: Paul Revoir Media Editor For The Daily Mail
